HDG.FS.content: “the being” for Plato understood in verbal sense (das Seiend) rather than nominal (das Seiende) > determinations of phainesthai and alēthes fully presented in eidos > nothing less Greek than Schopenhauer’s take on Plato (desert exists thanks to my thinking)
HDG.FS.linkedContent: “the being” for Plato understood in verbal sense (das Seiend) rather than nominal (das Seiende) > determinations of phainesthai and alēthes fully presented in eidos > nothing less Greek than Schopenhauer’s take on Plato (desert exists thanks to my thinking)

HDG.EC.content: devastation (Verwüstung): everything (human, world, earth) will transform into desert (Wüste) > desert is already there, doesn’t accumulate little by little, is there in an instant (Nu), in order to draw everything to it, to desert-ify (ver-wüsten)
HDG.EC.linkedContent: devastation (Verwüstung): everything (human, world, earth) will transform into desert (Wüste) > desert is already there, doesn’t accumulate little by little, is there in an instant (Nu), in order to draw everything to it, to desert-ify (ver-wüsten)

HDG.EC.content: desert is wasteland, deserted abandonment (Verlassenheit) of all life, nothing can emerge from itself [Greek physis] in this wasteland, & in this emergence (Aufgang) call others into a co-emerging (Mitaufgehen) > no perishing (Untergehen) in this desolation
